unit_learning_outcomes.description: Utilise complex numbers and techniques of differentiation and integration to determine and compare properties of single variable and multivariable functions.
Analyse the convergence of a wide range of infinite series, including Taylor series.
Analyse vectors and linear maps in spaces of arbitrary dimension, developing concepts such as vector spaces and eigenspaces.
Apply matrix inversion and decomposition methods to determine solutions to systems of linear equations.
Evaluate elementary numerical techniques for root finding, function approximation and integration, in order to assess the convergence criteria or the error estimate of the method.

non_scheduled_learning_activities.description: Class preparation time includes revising new content as soon as possible after lectures in order to identify, and fix, any issues before the next lecture, and thoroughly preparing for, and reflecting upon, SGTAs.

enrolment_rules.description: MATH1010(HD) or MATH1015 or MATH135(HD) or MATH132

assessments.description: This will be an online test held during the semester. It will test the ability of students to analyse and solve mathematical problems using concepts and techniques in linear algebra and calculus.
This will be an online test held during the semester. It will test the ability of students to analyse and solve mathematical problems using concepts and techniques in linear algebra and calculus.
This assignment will test the ability of students to solve theoretical mathematical problems using concepts and techniques from linear algebra and calculus, and prove mathematical statements.

This will be held during the final exam period. It will test the ability of students to synthesise the concepts taught in the course in order to analyse and solve mathematical problems with various applications.
Students are expected to demonstrate their ability to engage with the unit by participating in SGTA classes.

This will be an invigilated test held during the semester. It will test the ability of students to analyse and solve mathematical problems using concepts and techniques in linear algebra and calculus.

data.subject_search_title: MATH1025 - Calculus and Linear Algebra II (Advanced)
data.description: The foundations of linear algebra and calculus introduced in MATH1015 are further explored and extended. Topics covered in algebra include: inverse matrices, determinants, vector spaces & subspaces, eigenvalues and eigenvectors and linear transformations. In calculus the topics include: the further development of the concepts of limits, continuity and the derivative, numerical integration, polynomials, sequences & series and differential equations. In addition, complex numbers and the calculus of two or more variables are introduced. Students utilise mathematical software throughout the course to support and enhance problem solving for a variety of theoretical and practical problems.
